Authors:
Xavier Álvarez, Efrén Santos-Ordóñez, Ricardo Tamayo,
Silvia Robles
Title:
First phylogenetic characterization of the manglicolous
marine ascomycete Verruculina enalia (Kohlm.) Kohlm. & Volkm.-Kohlm.
in Ecuador
Keywords:
Mangrove forest, monosporic culture, Ecuador, Marine
fungi
Abstract:
Morphology and phylogenetic analyses of a monosporic
fungal isolate were performed. Mangrove wood were collected from the
Reserva Ecológica Manglares Churute, subsequently incubated to obtain
the reproduction structures (ascospores). These ascospores were
inoculated in standard culture media (PDA, PYG, and YMA). Once the
monosporic isolates were obtained, the DNA extraction was performed, and
three molecular markers corresponding to the loci ITS, LSU, and TEF1-,
were used. Molecular identification using the three DNA markers
supported morphological identification, demonstrating that the
morphologically identified isolate corresponded to Verruculina enalia.
The LSU and ITS revealed the best results for species identification by
obtaining DNA similarity percentages of 100%. Phylogenetic analyses with
sequences queried in the GenBank supported species identification for
the three loci analysed. Finally, the three markers used suggest a
high-resolution power for the molecular characterization of manglicolous
marine ascomycetes, combining molecular identification with previous
morphological identification.

trees.title:
Phylogenetic analysis for Verruculina enalia from
Ecuador based on the ITS alignment with accessions reported in the
GenBank.
